author: David Thompson
title: East Chambers rolls past Kountze 56-13
text:
East Chambers rolls past Kountze 56-13 David Thompso , Beaumont Enterprise By David Thompson Updated 9:42 am, Friday, October 2, 2015 
East Chambers overpowered Kountze in the second half to stroll to a 56-13 win over the Lions' Thursday night. 
WHAT HAPPENED: The Buccaneers (5-0, 2-0) took a 14-point halftime lead and extended it to 35 before three minutes could tick off the clock in the third quarter. 
East Chambers outscored Kountze 35-6 in the second half to continue their perfect season as the Lions (0-5, 0-2) continue to look for their first win of 2015. 
Dylan Silcox led the Bucs' with 11 rushes on 106 yards and two touchdowns, but only touched the ball once in the second half. Darius Guillory finished the night with three rushes for 107 yards with scores from 41 and 66 yards. 
The Bucs' rushed the ball 32 times for 350 yards, while quarterback Austin Sutherland completed two touchdowns passes to Kye Williams and Nick Thomas. 
Kountze found the end zone twice in the loss, a 37-yard reception from Grayland Arnold to Dayne Wright and a six-yard run from Keyshawn Adams in the third quarter. 
TURNING POINT: East Chambers needed only four plays on three possessions to score 21 points in the third quarter to turn a 21-7 lead into a 42-7 advantage. Scores came on a 6-yard run from Silcox, 66-yard run from Guillory and a 28-yard pass from Sutherland to Thomas. 
The Bucs' would add another score, a 43-yard run from Trevor Thomas , for a 28-point third quarter. 
"The ball bounced our way," said head coach Russ Sutherland. "We had a couple quick turnovers that turned into point and we grabbed the momentum." 
MOST-SPECTACULAR PLAY: With quarterback Aaron Sutherland on the sideline after taking a big hit from a Kountze defender late in the second quarter, Dylan Silcox made the most of his only throwing attempt of the night. 
Playing out of the shotgun on 3rd-and-12, the senior moved the pocket to the right side and found wide receiver Nick Thomas wide open 24 yards down field for a first down. 
BY THE NUMBERS: East Chambers had six players find the end zone during the win and came up with four interceptions against Kountze quarterback Grayland Arnold. Silcox nabbed three of those interceptions with the other coming from Cecillio Lopez . 
The Bucs' had nine players run the ball with five rushing for over 50 yards. 
HE SAID IT: "It's great when everyone can get in and we build enough cushion to do that," Sutherland said. "Give Kountze credit, they have good athletes and they will win some district games." 
RECORDS: East Chambers 5-0, 2-0. Kountze 0-5, 0-2. 
NEXT UP: East Chambers plays at Warren Friday, Oct. 9. Kountze plays at Hardin Friday, Oct. 9.
